Column Comment.0: LEGAL LOCATION REMARK: unique identifier for the land parcel remark. If desired,can be set to the ID of the land parcel described. However, the appropriate FK shouldalso be populated to retain integrity.
Column Comment.1: LOCATION TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of obj ect being given a legallocation. For example, node, well, ...
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: REMARK OBSERVATION NUMBER: Sequence number used for multipleobservations of a remark type.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: LAND PARCELTYPE: Type of Land parcel, such as Ohio, Congress, DLS, FPS,Texas etc
Column Comment.8: LEGAL LOCATION ID: unique identifier for the legal location
Column Comment.9: LEGAL LOCATION ID: unique identifier for the legal location
Column Comment.10: LEGAL LOCATION ID: unique identifier for the legal location
Column Comment.11: LEGAL LOCATION ID: unique identifier for the legal location
Column Comment.12: LEGAL LOCATION ID: unique identifier for the legal location
Column Comment.13: LEGAL LOCATION ID: unique identifier for the legal location
Column Comment.14: LEGAL LOCATION ID: unique identifier for the legal location
Column Comment.15: LEGAL LOCATION ID: unique identifier for the legal location
Column Comment.16: LEGAL LOCATION ID: unique identifier for the legal location
Column Comment.17: LEGAL LOCATION ID: unique identifier for the legal location
Column Comment.18: LEGAL LOCATION ID: unique identifier for the legal location
Column Comment.19: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.20: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.21: REMARK TYPE: Entries in this column describe the general topic of the remark, sothat remarks can be grouped by subject area. Topics might include royaltycomments, well comments, deficiencies, rental billing comments, etc.
Column Comment.22: NODE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to a specific point (node)
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.24: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.26: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.29: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
